the coarse, unpleasant expression peculiar to him. Shaking himself, he rose, threw back his head, 
and with resolute steps went past the ladies in- to the little drawing room. With quick steps he went joyfully up to Pierre. His face was so un- usually triumphant that Pierre rose in alarm on seeing it. 
"Thank God!" said Prince Vasfli. "My wife has told me everything!" (He put one arm around Pierre and the other around his daugh- ter.) "My dear boy . . . Lelya ... I am very pleased." (His voi
